item.title: 独资风险投资公司为早期初创企业创始人提供个性化服务
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是我们的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，Ed Ludlow 将与 DoNotPay 创始人兼首席执行官 Josh Browder 谈论如何作为唯一合伙人经营一家风险投资公司。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow talks with Josh Browder, founder and chief executive officer of DoNotPay, about running a venture capital firm as the only partner.】

item.title: 中美关税休战后赫伯罗特预订量激增
item.description: 就在几周前，集装箱航运公司的境况并不乐观。现货运价下跌，需求能见度接近于零，全球最大经济体之间的贸易战不断升级，使得该行业的命脉--全球商务--的前景黯淡。【原文：Just a few weeks ago, things weren’t looking so great for container shipping lines. Spot freight rates were sagging, demand visibility was near zero and an escalating trade war between the world’s largest economies dimmed the outlook for the industry’s lifeblood — global commerce.】

item.description:

The first battery will be installed in 2027 as part of a bid to provide reliable power.

】

item.title: 私人信贷的最新黄金时刻正在掩盖裂痕
item.description:
投资者仍对这一价值1.6万亿美元的资产类别趋之若鹜，尽管对其基础资产实力的质疑依然存在。【原文：

Investors are still flocking to the $1.6 trillion asset class, even as questions persist about the strength of its underlying assets. 

】

item.title: 欧盟削减农业繁文缛节以平息农民抗议
item.description: 几个月来的抗议活动使欧盟的农业政策受到严格审查，在此之后，欧盟将为农民提供更简单的融资，并放宽严格的环境规则。【原文：The European Union will provide simpler financing for farmers and ease strict environmental rules after months of protests that put the bloc’s agricultural policies under intense scrutiny.】

item.title: 日本力争在未来五年内实现 1%的实际工资增长
item.description: 日本政府很可能将实际工资增长 1%作为有史以来第一个官方加薪目标，此举是因为长期通胀继续拖累国内需求。【原文：The Japanese government is likely to establish 1% growth in real wages as its first-ever official target for pay increases, a move that comes as prolonged inflation continues to exert a drag on domestic demand.】

item.title: DHL 将与 Evri 合并英国快递部门，达成最新行业交易
item.description: 隶属于德国 DHL 集团的 DHL eCommerce UK 将与竞争对手 Evri 快递服务公司合并，这是拥挤的英国快递业一连串交易中的最新一笔。【原文：DHL eCommerce UK, part of Germany’s DHL Group, will merge with rival delivery service Evri, the latest in a string of deals in the crowded British courier space.】

item.title: 纳米比亚计划在减少进口战略中建设可再生能源发电厂
item.description: 作为减少电力进口战略的一部分，纳米比亚计划在截至 2026 年的财政年度增加 93 兆瓦的可再生能源发电能力。【原文：Namibia plans to add 93 megawatts of renewable energy capacity during the financial year ending 2026 as part of a strategy to reduce electricity imports.】

item.title: 英国央行正在寻找降低杠杆式金边债券交易风险的方法
item.description: 英格兰银行将就如何提高英国债券市场的抗风险能力以避免 2022 年金边债券危机重演征求投资者的意见。【原文：The Bank of England will consult investors on how to improve UK bond market resilience in order to avoid a repeat of the 2022 gilt crisis.】

item.title: 出售葡萄牙新银行引发对西班牙主导地位的担忧
item.description: 在葡萄牙同意将曾经是该国最大贷款机构的残余资产出售给 Lone Star Funds 八年之后，这家美国投资者出售 Novo Banco 的计划再次引发了该国根深蒂固的恐惧。【原文：Eight years after Portugal agreed to sell the remnants of what was once the country’s largest lender to Lone Star Funds, plans by the US investor to sell Novo Banco are reviving deep-seated fears in the country.】

item.title: 关税不会让美国重新工业化。以下是可以做到的
item.description:
要振兴制造业，美国需要借鉴中国的做法。【原文：

To revive manufacturing the US needs to borrow from China’s playbook.

item.title: 印度 Shapoorji 接近创纪录的 34 亿美元私人信贷交易
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，印度私营企业集团 Shapoorji Pallonji 集团计划最早于周三晚间签署一项 34 亿美元的债务协议，这将是印度有史以来最大的私人信贷交易。【原文：Privately-held Indian conglomerate Shapoorji Pallonji Group is aiming to sign a $3.4 billion debt deal as early as Wednesday evening, in what would be the country’s biggest ever private credit deal, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国建筑商万科偿还今年到期的唯一一笔美元债券
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国万科企业股份有限公司已汇出资金，用于偿还周一到期的美元债券，这是该公司在政府主导下对开发商进行全面整顿后，本年度唯一一笔此类债务。【原文：China Vanke Co. has wired funds to repay a dollar bond due on Monday, according to people familiar with the matter, clearing its only such obligation of the year after a government-led overhaul of the developer.】

item.title: 道达尔能源将向 HitecVision 出售波兰沼气部门 50% 的股份
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）同意将其波兰沼气生产业务50%的股份出售给挪威投资公司HitecVision AS，作为该石油巨头提高可再生能源投资回报率战略的一部分。【原文：TotalEnergies SE agreed to sell a 50% stake in its Polish biogas production business to Norwegian investment firm HitecVision AS as part of the oil major’s strategy to boost return on its renewables investments.】

item.title: 花旗和摩根大通认为 2025 年的落伍者将成为短期赢家
item.description: 随着贸易紧张局势的缓解，华尔街两大交易平台对美股做出了同样大胆的判断：投资今年的最大输家，快速获取短期利润。【原文：Two of Wall Street’s major trading desks are making the same bold call on US stocks as trade tensions ease: Pile into this year’s biggest losers for quick, short-term profits.】

item.title: 据说 Pony AI 将秘密申请在香港上市
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，自动驾驶公司 Pony AI 公司已秘密申请在香港上市，以帮助筹集资金发展业务。【原文：Autonomous-driving company Pony AI Inc. has confidentially filed for a Hong Kong listing to help raise capital to grow its business, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 中美贸易战加剧，中国新增贷款骤降 61
item.description: 由于与美国贸易紧张局势升级损害了市场情绪，中国 4 月份新增贷款大幅下滑，信贷扩张速度低于预期。【原文：China’s new loans slumped sharply and credit expanded at a slower pace than expected in April, as escalating trade tensions with the US harmed sentiment.】

item.title: 美国银行称印度成为最受欢迎的亚洲股市
item.description: 根据美银美林证券公司（BofA Securities）的最新月度调查，印度取代日本成为基金经理们在亚洲股市中的首选，因为这个南亚国家很可能在全球贸易紧张局势中受益于供应链的转移。【原文：India has replaced Japan as fund managers’ top Asian stock market pick, as the South Asian nation is likely to benefit from supply chain shifts amid global trade tensions, according to BofA Securities’ latest monthly survey.】

item.title: 香港大亨刘德华出售价值 450 万美元的葡萄酒收藏
item.description: 香港亿万富翁刘永好（Joseph Lau）将于下周在佳士得拍卖会上出售另一套葡萄酒收藏，估计价值超过 3500 万港元（450 万美元）。【原文：Hong Kong billionaire Joseph Lau is selling another wine collection with an estimated value exceeding HK$35 million ($4.5 million) in an auction by Christie’s next week.】

item.title: 阿克曼退出环球音乐董事会，专注于近期投资
item.description: 亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）辞去了全球最大音乐公司环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group NV）董事会的职务，理由是他最近的投资产生了一些义务。【原文：Billionaire Bill Ackman resigned from the board of Universal Music Group NV, the world’s largest music company, citing obligations arising from his recent investments.】

item.title: 专家小组建议日本政府实行免费分娩
item.description: 一个专家小组表示，日本政府应承担自付的分娩费用，因为这个老龄化国家正努力扭转人口减少和纳税工人队伍萎缩的局面。【原文：The Japanese government should cover out-of-pocket childbirth fees, an expert panel said, as the aging nation seeks to reverse its declining population and shrinking pool of tax-paying workers.】

item.title: 游戏势头强劲，腾讯收入增长 13
item.description: 在中国经济持续放缓的情况下，腾讯控股有限公司的游戏和社交媒体业务继续增长，营收超过预期。【原文：Tencent Holdings Ltd.’s revenue beat estimates after growing its gaming and social media portfolio through a persistent Chinese economic slowdown.】

item.title: 美韩货币谈判激发特朗普对弱势美元持开放态度的赌注
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士称，美国和韩国政府本月讨论了货币政策，这让人们猜测唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府对弱势美元持开放态度，并将汇率作为即将举行的贸易谈判的一个特点，美元因此下跌。【原文：The dollar fell after a person familiar with the matter said the US and South Korean governments discussed currency policies this month, fanning speculation President Donald Trump’s administration is open to a weaker greenback and will make exchange rates a feature of upcoming trade talks.】

item.title: 印尼提高棕榈出口税以促进生物燃料和植树造林
item.description: 印度尼西亚从5月17日起将毛棕榈油出口税从7.5%提高到10%，此举被广泛认为是为世界上最大的棕榈油生产国的生物燃料计划和重新种植工作提供资金。【原文：Indonesia raised its export levy on crude palm oil from 7.5% to 10% starting May 17 in a widely expected move to fund a biofuel program and replanting efforts in the world’s largest producer.】

item.description: 被无情反弹推回市场的股票投资者即将发现，真正的挑战才刚刚开始。【原文：Equity investors pushed back into the market by a relentless rally are about to find out that the real challenge is just beginning.】

item.title: 奇货可居：佩里-梅尔林谈特朗普的尼克松震荡回声（播客）
item.description: 最近有很多人在谈论唐纳德-特朗普的经济政策与 20 世纪 70 年代初尼克松冲击之间的相似之处。当时，这位前总统让美元脱离金本位，征收高额关税，并迫使美联储放宽货币政策。这些举措引发了美国的滞胀，并动摇了全球货币秩序。现在，鉴于特朗普决心重新平衡美国与全球贸易伙伴的关系，并对美联储提出了批评，因此，美国的货币政策可能会发生变化。【原文：There’s been a lot of talk recently about parallels between Donald Trump’s economic policies and the Nixon Shock of the early 1970s. That was when the former president took the dollar off the gold standard, introduced hefty tariffs, and pressured the Federal Reserve to ease monetary policy. The moves sparked stagflation in the US and shook up the global monetary order.
